description.narrative:
Seminar on methods for undertaking thorough conflict- and context analyses to contribute to building a foundation for development programmes and initiatives for cooperation, consisting of the best possible understanding of the internal relations in the countries that development agencies are engaging in. Such analysis is needed as the foundation for identification and design of the diplomatic, political, humanitarian, developmental, security and other engagements that Denmark and other countries contribute to and support financially, technically and with other means.
Tools for undertaking this kind of analyses in a sufficiently systematic manner are not yet sufficiently developed. The workshop focused on relevant and already existing material and tools as a basis for discussions on what will be the best way of undertaking this kind of analyses for a bilateral and relatively small partner as Danida, with the purpose of ensuring that the programmes and engagements do not cause any harm, but rather contribute to optimising the results and final goals for Danish development cooperation.
